comment.shortText: Aurelia Validation Configuration API
Applies the configuration.
Use a custom Validator implementation.
Part of the fluent rule API. Enables targeting properties and objects with rules.
Rules that have been defined using the fluent API.
Adds a rule definition to the sequenced ruleset.
Target a property with validation rules.

comment.text:
The property to target. Can be the property name or a property accessor
function.

comment.shortText: Targets an object with validation rules.
Applies the rules to a class or object, making them discoverable by the StandardValidator.
Part of the fluent rule API. Enables customizing property rules.
Rules that have been defined using the fluent API.

Applies the "email" rule to the property.
null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.
Target a property with validation rules.
Targets an object with validation rules.

Applies the "equals" validation rule to the property.
null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.

Applies the "matches" rule to the property.
Value must match the specified regular expression.
null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.

Applies the "maxItems" ARRAY validation rule to the property.
null and undefined values are considered valid.

Applies the "maxLength" STRING validation rule to the property.
null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.

Applies the "minItems" ARRAY validation rule to the property.
null and undefined values are considered valid.

Applies the "minLength" STRING validation rule to the property.
null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.
Applies the rules to a class or object, making them discoverable by the StandardValidator.

Applies the "required" rule to the property.
The value cannot be null, undefined or whitespace.
Applies an ad-hoc rule function to the ensured property or object.

comment.text:
The function to validate the rule.
Will be called with two arguments, the property value and the object.
Should return a boolean or a Promise that resolves to a boolean.

comment.shortText: Applies a rule by name.

comment.text: The name of the custom or standard rule.

comment.shortText:
Tags the rule instance, enabling the rule to be found easily
using ValidationRules.taggedRules(rules, tag)

Validate subsequent rules after previously declared rules have
been validated successfully. Use to postpone validation of costly
rules until less expensive rules pass validation.
Specifies a condition that must be met before attempting to validate the rule.

comment.text:
A function that accepts the object as a parameter and returns true
or false whether the rule should be evaluated.

comment.shortText: Specifies rule's validation message.
Specifies the key to use when looking up the rule's validation message.
Part of the fluent rule API. Enables applying rules to properties and objects.
Sets the display name of the ensured property.

Applies the "email" rule to the property.
null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.

Applies the "equals" validation rule to the property.
null and undefined values are considered valid.

Applies the "matches" rule to the property.
Value must match the specified regular expression.
null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.

Applies the "maxItems" ARRAY validation rule to the property.
null and undefined values are considered valid.

Applies the "maxLength" STRING validation rule to the property.
null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.

null and undefined values are considered valid.

null, undefined and empty-string values are considered valid.

The value cannot be null, undefined or whitespace.
Applies an ad-hoc rule function to the ensured property or object.

comment.text:
The function to validate the rule.
Will be called with two arguments, the property value and the object.
Should return a boolean or a Promise that resolves to a boolean.

comment.shortText: Applies a rule by name.

comment.text: The name of the custom or standard rule.

comment.shortText: Sets, unsets and retrieves rules on an object or constructor function.
The name of the property that stores the rules.
Retrieves the target's rules.
Applies the rules to a target.
Removes rules from a target.

Validates.
Responsible for validating objects and properties.
Determines whether a rule exists in a set of rules.
Validates all rules for specified object and it's properties.

comment.text:
Optional. If unspecified, the rules will be looked up using the metadata
for the object created by ValidationRules....on(class/object)

comment.shortText: Validates the specified property.

comment.text: The name of the property to validate.

Optional. If unspecified, the rules will be looked up using the metadata
for the object created by ValidationRules....on(class/object)

comment.shortText:
Binding behavior. Indicates the bound property should be validated
when the validate trigger specified by the associated controller's
validateTrigger property occurs.

Gets the DOM element associated with the data-binding. Most of the time it's
the binding.target but sometimes binding.target is an aurelia custom element,
or custom attribute which is a javascript "class" instance, so we need to use
the controller's container to retrieve the actual DOM element.
Binding behavior. Indicates the bound property should be validated.

Gets the DOM element associated with the data-binding. Most of the time it's
the binding.target but sometimes binding.target is an aurelia custom element,
or custom attribute which is a javascript "class" instance, so we need to use
the controller's container to retrieve the actual DOM element.

Binding behavior. Indicates the bound property will be validated
manually, by calling controller.validate(). No automatic validation
triggered by data-entry or blur will occur.

Gets the DOM element associated with the data-binding. Most of the time it's
the binding.target but sometimes binding.target is an aurelia custom element,
or custom attribute which is a javascript "class" instance, so we need to use
the controller's container to retrieve the actual DOM element.

Binding behavior. Indicates the bound property should be validated
when the associated element blurs.

Gets the DOM element associated with the data-binding. Most of the time it's
the binding.target but sometimes binding.target is an aurelia custom element,
or custom attribute which is a javascript "class" instance, so we need to use
the controller's container to retrieve the actual DOM element.

Binding behavior. Indicates the bound property should be validated
when the associated element is changed by the user, causing a change
to the model.

Gets the DOM element associated with the data-binding. Most of the time it's
the binding.target but sometimes binding.target is an aurelia custom element,
or custom attribute which is a javascript "class" instance, so we need to use
the controller's container to retrieve the actual DOM element.

Binding behavior. Indicates the bound property should be validated
when the associated element blurs or is changed by the user, causing
a change to the model.

Gets the DOM element associated with the data-binding. Most of the time it's
the binding.target but sometimes binding.target is an aurelia custom element,
or custom attribute which is a javascript "class" instance, so we need to use
the controller's container to retrieve the actual DOM element.

Orchestrates validation.
Manages a set of bindings, renderers and objects.
Exposes the current list of validation errors for binding purposes.
Errors that have been rendered by the controller.
The trigger that will invoke automatic validation of a property used in a binding.
Whether the controller is currently validating.
Adds and renders a ValidationError.
Adds an object to the set of objects that should be validated when validate is called.

comment.text: Optional. The rules. If rules aren't supplied the Validator implementation will lookup the rules.

comment.shortText: Adds a renderer.
Gets the elements associated with an object and propertyName (if any).

Interprets the instruction and returns a predicate that will identify
relevant errors in the list of rendered errors.
Registers a binding with the controller.

comment.text: (optional) rules associated with the binding. Validator implementation specific.

comment.shortText: Removes and unrenders a ValidationError.
Removes an object from the set of objects that should be validated when validate is called.
Removes a renderer.
Resets any rendered errors (unrenders).

comment.text: Optional. Instructions on what to reset. If unspecified all rendered errors will be unrendered.

comment.shortText: Resets the errors for a property associated with a binding.
Unregisters a binding with the controller.
Validates and renders errors.

comment.text:
Optional. Instructions on what to validate. If undefined, all
objects and bindings will be validated.

comment.shortText: Validates the property associated with a binding.
Creates ValidationController instances.
Creates a new controller instance.

Creates a new controller and registers it in the current element's container so that it's
available to the validate binding behavior and renderers.
A validation error.
The rule associated with the error. Validator implementation specific.
The error message.
The invalid object
The name of the invalid property. Optional.
A number that uniquely identifies the error instance.
Retrieves validation messages and property display names.

When a display name is not provided, this method is used to formulate
a display name using the property name.
Override this with your own custom logic.
Returns a message binding expression that corresponds to the key.
Fluent rule definition API.
Defines a custom rule.

comment.text: The name of the custom rule. Also serves as the message key.

A function that maps the rule's arguments to a "config"
object that can be used when evaluating the message expression.

comment.shortText: Target a property with validation rules.

comment.text: The property to target. Can be the property name or a property accessor function.

comment.shortText: Targets an object with validation rules.
Removes the rules from a class or object.
Returns rules with the matching tag.

Validates.
Responsible for validating objects and properties.
Determines whether a rule exists in a set of rules.
Validates all rules for specified object and it's properties.

comment.text:
Optional. If unspecified, the implementation should lookup the rules for the
specified object. This may not be possible for all implementations of this interface.

comment.shortText: Validates the specified property.

comment.text: The name of the property to validate.

Optional. If unspecified, the implementation should lookup the rules for the
specified object. This may not be possible for all implementations of this interface.

comment.shortText: An error to render (or unrender) and the associated elements (if any)
The associated elements (if any).
The validation error.
Defines which errors to render and which errors to unrender.
The "kind" of render instruction. Either 'validate' or 'reset'.
The errors to render.
The errors to unrender.
A rule definition. Associations a rule with a property or object.
Information related to a property that is the subject of validation.
The displayName of the property (or object).
The property name. null indicates the rule targets the object itself.
The object to validate.
The property to validate. Optional.
The rules to validate. Optional.
Renders validation errors.
Render the errors.

comment.text:
The render instruction. Defines which errors to render and which
errors to unrender.

comment.shortText: Validation triggers.
Dictionary of validation messages. [messageKey]: messageExpression
Configures the plugin.
Retrieves the object and property name for the specified expression.
